questions.question: You will need a truck to .................................... all these books.
questions.description: To carry off is to transport.

questions.question: She .................................. her role really well.
questions.description: To carry off one's role is to act convincingly.

questions.question: Every year epidemics ................................ thousands of people.
questions.description: Carry off can mean cause death.

questions.question: She moved to the city to ................................ her work.
questions.description: To carry on something is to continue doing it.

questions.question: You cannot ............................. spending money like that if you do not want to end up in debt.
questions.description: To carry on something is to continue doing it.

questions.question: It is difficult to .............................. a conversation if you do not know the language.
questions.description: To carry on is to maintain.

questions.question: As my subordinate, your duty is to .............................. my instructions.
questions.description: To carry out is to fulfill.

questions.question: They ................................ several experiments to prove their theory.
questions.description: To carry out is to do or perform.

questions.question: His problems in his personal life,  ............................... to his work.
questions.description: If something carries over, it continues to exist.

questions.question: Though she was extremely tired, she ............................. to the finish.
questions.description: To carry something through is to finish it successfully.

questions.question: We don't have enough supplies to carry us ............................ the winter.
questions.description: To carry someone through something is to help them survive a period of time.
